Events.RelatedDescription: Merged pull request "Deployment label log enrichment" (#7713) at NuGet/NuGetGallery
Events.RelatedBody:
Progress on https://github.com/NuGet/Engineering/issues/1912

Need it to differentiate between the deployments for app service conversion since `DeploymentIdTelemetryEnricher` will not work there. Unfortunately, this change will only work with App services, so for transition period we would need to look at both. I didn't find a way to pass this configuration bit to the cloud service configuration.

Events.RelatedDescription: Reopened issue "Response status code does not indicate success: 500 (Internal Server Error)" (#6890) at NuGet/NuGetGallery
Events.RelatedBody:
## Details about Problem

NuGet product used (NuGet.exe | VS UI | Package Manager Console | dotnet.exe):
NuGet.exe
NuGet version (x.x.x.xxx):
4.9.2.5706
dotnet.exe --version (if appropriate):

VS version (if appropriate):

OS version (i.e. win10 v1607 (14393.321)):
windows 10 1803
Worked before? If so, with which NuGet version:

## Detailed repro steps so we can see the same problem

1. I followed the Nuget document to publish the package, I've created the API keys, and it starts to PUT the package to https://www.nuget.org/api/v2/package/, my package is about 169MB.

2. After some time, it shows:
InternalServerError https://www.nuget.org/api/v2/package/ 602383ms, I don't get any detailed error information.

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/3942409/52620006-44005280-2ede-11e9-8aa5-d9740af10602.png)

Thanks!

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Unable to load the service index for source https://api.nuget.org/v3/index.json" (#7701) at NuGet/NuGetGallery
Events.RelatedBody:
Issue: [nuget.org] Unable to load the service index for source https://api.nuget.org/v3/index.json.
  An error occurred while sending the request.
  The request was aborted: Could not create SSL/TLS secure channel.
IDE: Visual Studio 2019
Please help me resolve it

Thanks

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue ""Could not create SSL/TLS secure channel" error in Visual Studio" (#7705) at NuGet/NuGetGallery
Events.RelatedBody:
### Describe the bug
Some Visual Studio customers are reporting the following error:

```
Unable to load the service index for source https://api.nuget.org/v3/index.json.
An error occurred while sending the request.
The request was aborted: Could not create SSL/TLS secure channel.
```

The NuGet team is actively investigating this problem. At this time, the issue's root cause is unknown. See: https://developercommunity.visualstudio.com/content/problem/815971/unable-to-browse-nuget-packages-1.html

### Workaround

Some customers have reported that disabling TLS 1.3 has resolved their issues:

```ps1
New-Item 'HKLM:\SYSTEM\CurrentControlSet\Control\SecurityProviders\SCHANNEL\Protocols\TLS 1.3\Server' -Force | Out-Null
	
New-ItemProperty -path 'HKLM:\SYSTEM\CurrentControlSet\Control\SecurityProviders\SCHANNEL\Protocols\TLS 1.3\Server' -name 'Enabled' -value '0' -PropertyType 'DWord' -Force | Out-Null
	
New-ItemProperty -path 'HKLM:\SYSTEM\CurrentControlSet\Control\SecurityProviders\SCHANNEL\Protocols\TLS 1.3\Server' -name 'DisabledByDefault' -value 1 -PropertyType 'DWord' -Force | Out-Null
	
New-Item 'HKLM:\SYSTEM\CurrentControlSet\Control\SecurityProviders\SCHANNEL\Protocols\TLS 1.3\Client' -Force | Out-Null
	
New-ItemProperty -path 'HKLM:\SYSTEM\CurrentControlSet\Control\SecurityProviders\SCHANNEL\Protocols\TLS 1.3\Client' -name 'Enabled' -value '0' -PropertyType 'DWord' -Force | Out-Null
	
New-ItemProperty -path 'HKLM:\SYSTEM\CurrentControlSet\Control\SecurityProviders\SCHANNEL\Protocols\TLS 1.3\Client' -name 'DisabledByDefault' -value 1 -PropertyType 'DWord' -Force | Out-Null
Write-Host 'TLS 1.3 has been disabled.'
```

You may also need to change your .NET Framework default TLS version:

```ps1
reg add HKLM\SOFTWARE\Microsoft\.NETFramework\v4.0.30319 /v SystemDefaultTlsVersions /t REG_DWORD /d 1 /f /reg:64
reg add HKLM\SOFTWARE\Microsoft\.NETFramework\v4.0.30319 /v SystemDefaultTlsVersions /t REG_DWORD /d 1 /f /reg:32
```

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "Gallery should reject packages with duplicate dependencies" (#7714) at NuGet/NuGetGallery
Events.RelatedBody:
These packages can't be opened by some tools (NuGet Package Explorer) and the semantics of a duplicate dependency are undefined.

For example:
https://www.nuget.org/packages/Paket.Core/5.237.1

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/94054/69655106-bf289480-102a-11ea-9368-ee717e540b9b.png)

These duplicate dependencies became an array with two items for the dependency range, which is invalid and caused Catalog2Lucene to get blocked.

/cc @zhhyu

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Support specifying path to Nuget.Config for NuGet settings on VS" (#7533) at NuGet/Home
Events.RelatedBody:
In a large, multi-solution environment, managing Nuget sources can be a problem, especially when repeated change is required in those sources. By default, when no solution is open, you edit your machine's nuget.config and when you edit your local folder's nuget.config. This can lead to dozens of nuget.config files existing that need to be found and updated when a change occurs.

it would be great to be able to specify a file path for the nuget.config to use for a solution.

It would be better if we could specify a source control path to use for nuget.config for the solution.

_This issue has been moved from https://developercommunity.visualstudio.com/content/idea/384979/support-specifying-path-for-nugetconfig.html VSTS ticketId: 731466_ _These are the original issue comments:_ Fiona Niu[MSFT] on 11/18/2018, 08:22 PM (44 hours ago):

Thank you for taking the time to provide your suggestion. We will do some preliminary checks to make sure we can proceed further. You will hear from us in about a week on our next steps.

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue ""dotnet restore" fails if "nuget" folder doesn't exist" (#8264) at NuGet/Home
Events.RelatedBody:
_From @gthvidsten on Wednesday, June 26, 2019 11:58:14 AM_

## Steps to reproduce

I cloned a repo, but restore of NuGet packages (`dotnet restore`) failed with the following message:

> C:\Program Files\dotnet\sdk\2.2.101\NuGet.targets(114,5): error : The local source 'C:\ClonedRepo\nuget' doesn't exist. [C:\ClonedRepo\src\SomeProject\src\SomeProject.csproj]

I manually created `C:\ClonedRepo\nuget` and ran `dotnet restore` again, and now it worked just fine.

## Expected  behavior

`dotnet restore` should create the `nuget` folder if it doesn't exist.

## Actual behavior

`dotnet restore` fails because it can't find non-existing folder

## Environment data
`dotnet --info` output:

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "nuget global packages folder not generating" (#8355) at NuGet/Home
Events.RelatedBody:
@Geof23 commented on [Tue Jul 16 2019](https://github.com/NuGet/docs.microsoft.com-nuget/issues/1543)

I have nuget packages from multiple sources, including just a local drive.

I have added all of these to the package manager settings.  I also have added a line to the solution nuget.config file:
```

<config>	
    <add key="globalPackagesFolder" value=".\packages" />
  </config>	

```
Also, I had to add packages.config files manually to the projects that I want dependent upon nuget packages.  They weren't otherwise available in the solution 'manage nuget packages' view.

Below is my version and config info of Visual Studio.

Are there some hidden NuGet logs that might help me?  I've checked the compiler command lines, and they do refer to the [solution]/packages folder (but despite my efforts, it doesn't exist, and I don't want to manually generate!)

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Please allow for prioritizing sources" (#7938) at NuGet/Home
Events.RelatedBody:
If the same package exists in two different sources I would like the ability to prioritize one source over another.  These are various use cases where we already depend on this behavior and it appears to be working.

See https://github.com/NuGet/Home/issues/3676 for a related issue.

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "run powershell script after package installed" (#8824) at NuGet/Home
Events.RelatedBody:
hi i want to execute powershell script for modify a file. 
I noticed that the script runs during installation And so I can't edit the file because it's not there yet and it's being built by Visual Studio
What should i do?
My script is on this path:
**tools\install.ps1**

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "Nuget package can be installed multiple times in different versions" (#8865) at NuGet/Home
Events.RelatedBody:
## Details about Problem

NuGet product used (NuGet.exe | VS UI | Package Manager Console | dotnet.exe): VS UI
VS version : 16.3.10

## Detailed repro steps so we can see the same problem

Use a .NET SDK project
- install at least one nuget package
- Lets assume we have incorrect resolved merge conflict: 
    - open the .NET SDK project with a text editor and
    - copy the Itemgroup with the PackageReferences directly behind the existing package reference item group. 
- Open the project again in visual studio. It builds, restores the files and throws no error

--> I would expect to see an error. Furthermore the GUI does not complain and is not able to resolve this issue by updating the packages.

### Verbose Logs
### Sample Project
The .net sdk project at the end contains code like this: 
```
<ItemGroup>
    <PackageReference Include="Autofac">
      <Version>4.9.4</Version>
    </PackageReference>
</ItemGroup>
<ItemGroup>
    <PackageReference Include="Autofac">
      <Version>4.9.3</Version>
    </PackageReference>
</ItemGroup>
```

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "How do I install NuGet.Tools.vsix that I compiled?" (#8857) at NuGet/Home
Events.RelatedBody:
## Details about Problem

NuGet product used VS UI

NuGet version (5.5.0.54553)

VS version 16.3.10:

OS version  Win7 SP1 x64 :


## Detailed repro steps so we can see the same problem
Hello, due to the poor support for props in the official version, such as unable to import Shared ImportGroup or ExtensionSettings ImportGroup in C++ Project.

So I modified the source code and compiled it to get NuGet.Tools.vsix, but I couldn't install it. What should I do to install my NuGet.Tools.vsix? I'm eager to get help to make C++ better. 

Thank you

mingkuang

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "nuget restore sln really slow" (#8864) at NuGet/Home
Events.RelatedBody:
Hi guys,

I have an issue with the nuget 5.x version.

When i make a nuget restore from a sln file (packages are downloaded the first time and the second time they are copy from the cache)

Thats strange but when the copy come from cache it is really slow. I have that on several server (Windows Server 2016). With my user account it look fine ~ 1mn to restore 70 package. It take ~10mpn with other account.

Any idea ?
